dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've got wiener breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that disgusting hot dog you had for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny starts kissing her over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Tom! Gross!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally pushes him off.  He rolls off of her and snug to her, spooning her in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I make that song melancholy when I play it? I think of what my life would be like without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz smiles, snuggles closer to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, let's spend the night here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no motels around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Right here on the beach.  Come on. Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sitting at the vanity holding the trumpet.  THE IMA PROJECTED ON THE WALL BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the vanity, whispering) Okay, we'll stay.  We'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the beach) Come on, Liz. We'll get eaten alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the vanity, softly) No ... We'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK ON THE IMAGE as Danny and Liz walk away from the sho The sun sinks completely below the horizon. A long fish hawk floats on the last of the thermals. The dying fish breaths its last. Danny (at the vanity) closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trumpet goes back in the case. The lid is closed. The case goes back in the box. The neatly folded clothes are laid on top. The box goes back to the shelf. The light in the closet is turned off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Tanner sitting across from one another at a pic Tanner writing serial numbers down as he counts out SEVER DOLLAR BILLS. Danny watching silently. Tanner puts the bills in an envelope, licks the flap, sea slides it over to Danny, who doesn't touch it. The envelope lays there between them for the following co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm a Judas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to compare the people you're taking down with the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti thinks I'm a pile of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti thinks everything is shit. He doesn't even like dolphins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny smiles. TANNER (cont'd) I'm serious.  He hates 'em.  You ever hear of anyone who didn't like dolphins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner shakes his head and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for not judging me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you wonder why I do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money? The drugs? Keeping yourself out of jail? I know the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't find that repugnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the way the world works.  Look, as far as tweakers go, you aren't a bad guy.  You never hurt anyone but yourself as far as I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell that to Bobby ... and his wife and kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby laid his own tracks.  He could have gone quietly but he played the hard-ass con till the end. And as far as I'm concerned, he wife and kid are a hell of a lot better off without him. (beat) Now take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stuffs the money into his jacket. TANNER (cont'd) One think I do want to know is how the hell did you get yourself into this position to start with?  You seem like a smart enough guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long story.  Maybe I'll tell you all about it some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti emerges from the men's room, zipping up. DANNY (cont'd) Hey, Garcetti ... You ever get confused and try to flush yourself? Garcetti (all business) You tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tanner) Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti sits down next to Danny. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock concern) Danny, it's really pains me to have to tell you this, but do you remember DOMINGO, that wetback you helped us put away for trafficking a few months back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out he's connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mexicali Boys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does this have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti puts his hand on Danny's shoulder, really playin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows somebody ratted him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's making a lot of noise about having his homies hang a Colombian necktie on whoever it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti leans in close GARCETTI (cont'd) You know that thing where they slit your throat and pull your tongue out of the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny knocks Garcetti's hand away and stands up.  Garcett GARCETTI (cont'd) Apparently they call it a necktie because it hangs down about yay long and looks very similar to a tie. Isn't that weird, Danny?  Isn't that weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Garcetti!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny turns to Tanner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he finds out it's me, I'm a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, he isn't gonna find out it's you.  Domingo was a slinger, he must have sold to hundreds of different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny paces back and forth. TANNER (cont'd) And if you're that worried about it, maybe you ought to get out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell am I gonna do that?  You guys are still stringing me a long on that possession charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock surprise) You mean that hasn't been cleared up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti chuckles at Danny's fear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Garcetti. I been at this for almost a year. I've done everything you guys have asked of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone ever ask you to be such a disrespectful smart-ass all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we'll talk to the A.D.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon. I promise.  We'll get the charges dropped and you can disappear.  In the mean time, trust me, he has no idea that you ratted him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sitting cross-legged in front of a gravestone. A PICKUP TRUCK slowly winds its way up the access road to Danny stands up.  Dusts his pants off. The truck stops nearby.  The strains of GARTH BROOKS from Danny approaches.  The passenger's side window rolls down ... A BAD-ASSED ASIAN DUDE behind the wheel. He wears a c a rodeo belt.  He looks like the Chinese Marlboro man.  T An AIRBRUSH painting on the door panel - a bad likeness o astride a horse, dressed as a cowboy with a huge-breasted Anderson-type on the saddle behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking out the painting) Ride 'em cowboy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (southern twang) You like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wouldn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First rate, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's downright classy is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba fires up a cigarette, revealing a pock-marked face. gun in a tooled leather shoulder holster. DANNY (cont'd) You consider my presentation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in, hoss.  We'll talk it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny climbs in.  The window goes back up.  As the care p ... ... MOVE back over to the gravestone. The stone reads: "ELIZABETH VAN ALLEN.  BELOVED WIFE"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A non-descript. cinder block bar.  No windows.  No frills

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sitting at the bar, nursing a drink.  He looks nerv darting around for potential assassins. He has nothing to worry about with this crowd, harmless a Jimmy The Finn enters and approaches Danny.  Danny signal go to the back, then gets up and follows him, carrying tw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, you don't look so hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy has dark circles under his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hurting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You on a roll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was.  I'm on the fucking ghost train right now, man.  You got anything for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it have to feel so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're brain is in reverse mode ... cutting off your supply of dopamine. Here.  Have a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sighs, scratches his arms.  They are all scabbed up DANNY (cont'd) You see the crank bugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. (guzzles some beer) Man, Danny, how do you keep your shit together so tight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, dude.  You always seem to be on top of things, even when you're tweakin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess there's just no substitute for good genes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy finishes his beer.  Danny signals to the cocktail w more beer. DANNY (cont'd) You hear about Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's a pity.  Truly a pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny smiles at Jimmy's choice of words. JIMMY (cont'd) He was a good supplier. (gets an idea) You think maybe there's any drugs left in his room?  You know, like hidden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of doubt it, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beers arrive.  Jimmy lays into his, downing it in one Danny slides his over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why'd you want to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business.  I need to leave town and I find myself in dire need of some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that?  That's just what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. You're smooth. You use words like dire and shit.  You got language skills, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get carried away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find myself in dire need of some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy shakes his head in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that guy you told me about ... said he could handle a big hook-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Pooh-Bear.  Dude is a big-time cook. I'm talking dire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a buyer.  Guy's looking for a quarter's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quarter?  Danny that ain't even worth ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quarter of a million, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's a drug-addled eyes catch a glimmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can your man handle that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.  I mean, we'd have to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you set that up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sucks what's left of his beer down. JIMMY (cont'd) What's in it for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a 10% finder's fee from my man if I can get the right price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy becomes paralyzed by the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 grand.  You introduce me to your boy, I'll cut you five grand out of my take.  That's all you gotta do, just get me in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny walking home.  Sparse traffic on the street. He wal head down and his hands thrust in his pockets. A RED CAR approaches from the opposite direction. It SLOW Danny. Danny looks over. The DRIVER is obscured by the reflected glare of a street is obvious that he is staring right at Danny. Danny plays it cool. Keeps walking. The red car pulls a SLOW U-TURN. Danny hauls ass. The red car catching up. 7Danny runs down a service street which runs through the series of apartment complexes. The red car follows, slowly prowling the street. Danny squeezed behind a dumpster, watching. It is now too dark to see the driver.  The car comes to a Danny hugging the dumpster tight. Another car pulls into the tight street, behind the red c driver of the other car SOUNDS HIS HORN.  The red car spe Danny walks quickly the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAY-TOO-YOUNG BLACK KID stares DIRECTLY AT CAMERA, an A HANDGUNS, KNIVES, RIFLES AND SECURITY EQUIPMENT spread ou dining room table before him. He is squeezed into a terry-cloth jumpsuit, his body fest gold jewelry, his hair all wet jerry-curl. He looks like Barry White, Jr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, I only deal in high-end weapons.  All guaranteed stolen and traceable only to their original owners.  All sales are final and all prices are negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid speaks in a HUSKY MONOTONE, completely FLAT and H sounds like one of those kids selling candy door-to-door memorized pitch told by rote. KID (cont'd) (rapid fire delivery) Glock semi-automatic 9 mm.  Tenifer matte finish, Polymer grip, fixed sights, 4 and 1/2 inch barrel, 22 ounces, double action and a 10 round magazine.  Mister, I could hook you up with this gun for the low price of three hundred and "fitty" dollars - well below market value. (next gun, no pause) Tangfolio semi-automatic.  This a 9mm too - seems to be the weapon of choice - try one and you'll understand why. Rubber grips, adjustable 3 dot sights, 4 and 1/2 inch barrel, 33 ounces.  Check out the eye-catching extended beaver tail just above the grip.  Got mad-ass double action and a surprising 16 round magazine. Mister, I want to sell you this gun and I can hook you up for the low price of 200 dollars. (next gun, breakneck pace) Maybe you looking for something in a chrome finish.  Something to impress the ladies. This right here is a Llama Mini-Max .38 Super Auto. semi-automatic. Fresh satin chrome, black rubber grip, 3 dot fixed sights, 3 and 1/2 inch barrel, skeletonized hammer with an extended slide release, eight capacity magazine and single action. Mister, I won't lie to you, this gun is not the bomb - it'll do the job, KID (cont'd) but it ain't all that.  That's why you can walk out of here with this gun for the incredible low price of one hundred and "fitty" dollar. (next one) Maybe you looking for power, mister. This gun got mad power, mad kick and mad reputation.  That's right, it's the Colt .357 Magnum revolver. Rubber combat-style grip, fixed rear, ramp front sights, 2 inch barrel. Weighs in at a feather-like 21 ounces.  6 shot capacity with double action. Mister, if you're looking for impact, the Magnum will satisfy all of your needs. (the last gun) I don't know you, mister, but you look like a man of style so maybe you in the market for a custom piece. Mister, it's your lucky day 'cause this gun got style to burn.  You lookin' at the Les Baer Custom Premier Tactical 45. Fresh blue finish, deluxe grips, 5 inch barrel, 37 ounces, guaranteed to shoot 1 1/2 groups at a distance of 50 yards.  Aluminum speed trigger, throated barrel, single action with 12 shot capacity magazine.  I could see you with this gun, mister.  And I can give it to you for the low price of seven hundred and ninety-five dollars.  Mister, these are my guns. All sales are final, and all prices are negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes .... staring at ... Danny and Jimmy, standing there, wide-eyed and amazed by sales pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of decaying stucco apartment buildings.  Danny and J away from one of the structures. Danny pockets the GLOCK he just purchased.  He also carri PROOF VEST over this shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, where do you find these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Del Ammo Mall mostly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna score some go-fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue on. Jimmy looks at the vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why do you need a gun and a vest anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal protection. It's a dangerous world we live in, Jimmy, a very dangerous world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRASHY LOOKING DUDE banging on Colette's door. Danny at his door, fumbling with his keys, watching the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees Danny eyeballing him) You mad dogging me, Bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavens no. I was just admiring your boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dude looks down at this beat-up motorcycle boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you purchase them locally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dude ignores Danny and keeps pounding on the door. DANNY (cont'd) Goodbye now. Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny enters.  AN ARGUMENT ENSUES NEXT DOOR between the d Colette. The sounds of a struggle.  Colette screams.  The dude yel top of his lungs.  A LOUD SMACK. SILENCE. Colette sobbing. The dude talking in hushed tones, contri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spray painted rusty Chevy Vega belching black smoke.  A lights are broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy driving.  Danny in the passenger's seat, looking do ... the floorboard, or lack thereof.  It is completely ru freeway rushes by underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Jimmy, you might as well put a sign on the back of this thing asking the cops to pull you over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like to throw 'em off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's what I mean. (beat) Where the hell does this guy live anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palmdale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they call him Pooh-Bear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think on account of his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to explain that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to give me a little more than that, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know how Winnie the Pooh always got his nose stuck in the honey jar? Well, Pooh-Bear snorted so much crank, they had to cut his nose off. He's got a plastic one though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny wonders what he's getting himself into. JIMMY (cont'd) You know, they say he hasn't slept in over a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see Queen Elizabeth sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No (beat) You think she's a tweaker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling old ranch house tucked into the remote hills A GUY passes out in the front yard.  A DOG sniffs at him, pissing on him.  He never moves. A PILE OF DEAD PIGEONS near the driveway. CLOSE ON POOH-BEAR - he does indeed have a prosthetic nos blends in with his face but not quite, making it that muc disconcerting. He takes a huge hit of crystal meth from a pipe, holds it long exhale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go gentlemen ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REMOTE CONTROLLED CAR trundles out of the garage and al driveway. Inside the car, FOUR PIEGEONS, their bodies wra Pooh-Bear working the remote control device. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Zapruder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUY filming the whole thing with a super-8 camera. GRAINY SUPER 8 FOOTAGE: the pigeons continue along, their glazed with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oswald?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER GUY sighting a scoped pellet gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grassy knoll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THIRD GUY aiming a pellet gun further down and to the r "Oswald".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third shooter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE THIRD SHOOTER is also armed with a pellet gun

dialogues.speaker: THIRD SHOOTER
dialogues.text: It's a go. Pooh-Bear watches anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Kennedy waving to the crowd, his lovely wife looking radiant beside him as they turn into Dealey Plaza ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAINY FOOTAGE: the car making a turn, the pigeons oblivi POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Stand by, gentlemen.  Stand by ... (beat, eyes widening) Steady .... steady ... FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men open up simultaneously. GRAINY FOOTAGE: a mass of feathers flying as the pigeons Pooh-Bear pumps his fist. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Yes!  Yes! (beat) Out! That's a wrap.  Good job, boys. Good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car continues rolling past the feet of ... ... Danny and Jimmy, who have been watching the whole thi periphery POOH-BEAR (cont'd) (to Danny and Jimmy) So? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad-libbing) - Cool. - Yeah. Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear takes the camera from "Zapruder".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the camera) I'm gonna get this developed and send it to the Warren Commission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I think the Warren Commission has been closed for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit? (thinking) Fuck it.  I'll send it to Oliver Stone then. He'll get them to reopen the bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear! We got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oswald is standing over the car, prodding one of the pige pellet gun. OSWALD (cont'd) J.F.K.'s still alive. (beat) Should I finish him off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear and Danny alone in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Danny, Jimmy tells me you have a proposition for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear picks at a plate of SCRAMBLED EGGS on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I uh, have a buyer who's looking for about a quarter's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crank or glass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good stuff.  Can you handle that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear chews his food and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Would you like a taste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist. It's delicious. Just a taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not wanting to offend him, Danny concedes.  Pooh-Bear sho into Danny's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret recipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear winks and shovels some more down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make me an offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, 14,000 a kilo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deal in U.S. pounds, friend. None of that faggot metric crap for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay ... How about um .. 6,000 a ounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthusiastic) Hey, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks surprised. It was too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything for a dear friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're a friend of Jimmy's. I think of you as a brother already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear takes another bite of eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's 40 lbs. at 6 a pound then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear, I don't mean to be rude, but I get the feeling you aren't taking me seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear puts the plate down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're the one who isn't taking me seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I welcome you here with open arms and you got the nerve to low-ball me like some slick used car salesman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I was just trying to ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (never losing his smile) I want to tell you about the last guy who tried to jam me up on a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't play that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you don't.  At least I'm sure you think you don't.  Anyway, I want to tell you. It's a good story, guaranteed to break the ice at a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear leans back, grinning broadly POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Dude shorted me eleven dollar ... thought I wouldn't count it till I got home.  Wrong. (beat) You know what I did? (beat) I clamped his head in a vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK FLASH BACK: LOW ANGLE SLOW-MOTION CLOSE-UP of Pooh- down at something OFFSCREEN, a menacing look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have heard him howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO PRESENT: Pooh-Bear lights a cigarette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I took a Saws All and I cut His skull open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK FLASH: CONTINUE SLOW MOTION CLOSE UP. Pooh-Bear rea something OFFSCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) You know, those Saws All really do cut through everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO PRESENT: Danny getting nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you don't have to ... POOH-BEAR (cont'd) So I'm standing there looking at this dude's brain and I'm thinking to myself, you know, this guy doesn't really need this thing. I mean, anyone stupid enough to jam me up doesn't really use their brain to begin with. You know what I'm saying? (beat, dead serious) So I took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear makes a POPPING SOUND as he illustrates with hi QUICK FLASH BACK: Pooh-Bear looking down at SOMETHING in face blossoming into a sick smile. BACK TO PRESENT: Danny listens somberly. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) Hell, I make better use out of it than he ever did.  Got it up in my freezer. I take it out from time-to- time, mix a little of it up in my dinner .... (looks at the plate of eggs) ... of breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE PLATE - little chunks of gray matter mixed in with Pooh-Bear smiles knowingly.  Danny turns pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10,000 a pound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny decides to nerve it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're insulting me.  Nice talking business with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny gets up to leave. One of his hands shaking uncontro steadies it with the other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9,000.  Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave it.  Eight is as high as I'll go.  See ya'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny goes to leave again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. Don't get your knickers in a knot. I can live with eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear stands up. POOH-BEAR (cont'd) You got a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn, Danny, you got some nerve. Pooh-Bear respects that. (beat) Oh, by the way ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear takes something from the kitchen counter and to table ... ... a store-bought package of COW BRAINS. QUICK FLASH BACK: REVEAL that Pooh-Bear has been standing section in a GROCERY STORE. He is looking down at the pac BRAINS in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the grocery store) Hmm. Good price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh-Bear tosses the package in his cart and walks away,

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: POOH-BEAR (cont'd) You want to stay for lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny has been had.  Pooh-Bear laughs uproariously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny slouched in the passenger's seat. Jimmy holds out a bullet dispenser of crank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pockets the drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does J.F.K. stand for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Fitzgerald Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he the president?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Jimmy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy drives for a while, then ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for not laughing at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DAPPER OLD MAN in a wheelchair crooning a Muzak-like ve Reed's WALK ON THE WILD SIDE on a cheapo Karaoke set-up i the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, a la Perry Como) Sugar Plum Fairy never once gave it away. Everybody had to pay and pay ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, Jimmy, Kujo and Creeper sitting in a booth. Jimmy and Creeper are amped, jaws grinding, eyes bugging. Kujo rambles on but Danny isn't listening. He looks exhau is pinched, there are bags under his eyes.  He scans the on ... ... Colette AND HER TRASHY DUDE BOYFRIEND Colette sees Danny looking.  Smiles at him.  Danny return until the trashy dude looks over.  Danny looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, listen up.  Here's the deal ... my wife's pimp knows a guy who works at Cedars Sinai medical lab.  They're getting a very special delivery a week from this Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo leans in and lowers his voice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob Hope's stool specimen (beat) We're gonna boost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why in God's name would we want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can sell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  A collector.  Fuck Danny, it's Bob Hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a national treasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny shakes his head in amazement, then looks back at Co She sneaks another look at him. ON THE TABLE - Kujo slides a drink glass in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out.  This is the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stark hospital hallway. A placard on one of the doors -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeper points at the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean what kind of drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuba Libre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that? Rum and coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to be straight on the details.  Can I taste it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can't taste it.  It's the fucking lab! Now shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny amused by the conversation.  He sees something out of his eye ... The boyfriend kissing Colette roughly.  She obviously isn it. Danny watching intently. KUJO (cont'd) Danny, come on. If I'm gonna let you in on the opportunity of a lifetime, the least you can do is pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny turns back to the table. Kujo slides another glass KUJO (cont'd) This is the courier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should use something smaller. He's the same size as the office. It doesn't ring true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo rolls his eyes.  He uses a peanut instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the colored girls sing doot-de-doot ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A courier exits from the elevator carrying a medical samp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He delivers at four o'clock on the nose every Friday.  Alpha team will be in the elevator with the courier. That'll be Danny and Creeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE INTO THE ELEVATOR - Creeper standing in the corner a on his feet, drool trickling down his mouth. KUJO (cont'd) Every member of the team will be equipped with night vision goggles, a police scanner and two-way radios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door closes on the dosing Creeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides over two peanuts behind the courier peanut. KUJO (cont'd) ... number two team, which will be me and Jimmy, will be positioned in the stairwell at the other end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo slides over two more peanuts. The trashy dude heads into the bathroom.  Danny sneaks an Colette.  This time, she gives him a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo emerges from the stairwell, also alone, approaching He is wearing shorts, a tank top and after-ski boots.  He powdery crank donut around his nostrils. KUJO (cont'd) With alpha team following from the elevator, number two team will approach from the stairwell, cutting the courier off before he reaches the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creeper still fast asleep inside the elevator.   He wakes breaking down into a karate stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courier peanut is now surrounded by the other peanuts cashew. KUJO (cont'd) Facing superior numbers and an array of high-tech weapons the courier will have no choice but to comply with our de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo and the courier playing tug-of-war with the case.  K dustbuster vacuum at the courier like it was a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy listening intently, takes some of the peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Jimmy, you at the alpha team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pulls peanut paste from his mouth and mounds them u table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said hey sugar, take a walk on the wild side ... KUJO (cont'd) Now here's the beautiful part.  The getaway.  Both teams will rappel right down the center of the stairwell, change clothes and walk right out the front door like nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo tumbling head-over-heals down the metal steps.  He g feet, a bloody mess. The kit has sprung open, sending shit samples everywhere. Kujo quickly scrapes as much as he can back into a contai off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kujo bolts out the front door, into the street and direct path of ... ... an ONCOMING AMBULANCE, which drags him underneath for feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny watches as the trashy dude exits the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's it gonna be, Danny boy? You in or out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trashy dude goes to Colette.  It looks like he wants to l doesn't. KUJO (cont'd) Danny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trashy dude grabs her by the back of the neck, lifts her and pushes her out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Colette) I'm afraid I'm gonna have to pass on this one, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny watches her exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny approaches his door. Stops.  Colette is sitting in the hall, head in hands, sobbing.  Danny starts to say something. Stops. Goes to this door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? She nods.  DANNY (cont'd) Well...good night then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny starts to enter again. Stops again.  DANNY (cont'd) Why are you out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincey, my boyfriend... he kicked me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny isn't quite sure what to do. He takes a half-step t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...I'd like to help you out ... but I really don't want to get involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. Thanks anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up. That face. Those eyes. Everything about her involved."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Colette in a near-deserted retro coffee shop. A LONE WAITRESS AND COOK mull behind the counter. Colette's mascara is running.  Danny hands her a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dabs at her eyes. COLETTE (cont'd) I'm so embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at herself in a compact mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I look like a raccoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking Alice Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her head in her hands.  Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, cheer up. It could be worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know .... you could be staking your financial future on stealing Bob Hope's stool specimen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs DANNY (cont'd) See. No matter how bad things are, there's always someone a little worse off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the guy on the very bottom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny holds up his water glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, I still try to see the glass as half-full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a sip. DANNY (cont'd) Problem is, it's usually half-full of something that tastes a  lot like urine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a face.  Sets the glass down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be worse. (beat) Oh sorry, forgot who I was talking to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette sips her coffee.   Danny looks around nervously. DANNY (cont'd) Hey, did I mention that I was a coward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette frowns, not sure what he means. DANNY (cont'd) Quincey. You sure he isn't gonna come looking for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he's probably passed out with his head in the toilet by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man sounds like a real catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's a keeper all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's really none of my business but why don't you just dump this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, down deep he's really not a bad person and you don't want to see him get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you, Dr. Joyce Brothers? (beat) I hate the son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to understand.   The guy is a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get off on abuse or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't you leave? (beat) Just give me one good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he'll kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress and cook look up. COLETTE (cont'd) Is that simple enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you call the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? They don't hold him for more than a day or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's long enough to get out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I've got a kid.  She lives with my parents.  Quincey knows where they live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny chews it over for a second then ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then make sure he gets put away for longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny hesitates, not sure of how much he wants to get inv COLETTE (cont'd) Tell me how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (beat) Let me think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urban blight abounds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grafitti-filled, cluttered shell of what used to be s offices. BUBBA THE ASIAN COWBOY sitting on a desk. Danny pacing ba in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Texas drawl) I wanna do a small buy first.  Ten thousand.  We'll see how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? The guys is ready to deal now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't know him and I don't really know you, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's down-right insulting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to live with that.  My money my risk, my rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba takes a plastic-wrapped bundle of money from his po it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner and Garcetti ensconced in an alley diagonally acro Garcetti pointing a LONG-RANGE PARABOLIC MICROPHONE at th building.  He and Tanner wear earpieces, which are attach mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered, broken) I guess I don't have a hell of a lot of choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Get used to it.  You're in a very tenuous position on the food chain, hoss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti removes his earpiece and turns to Tanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thinking what I'm thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  This could be the one we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba exits the building and disappears around the corner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny now alone. He picks up the bundle of cash.  Turns t ... ... Tanner and Garcetti enter the building.  Danny turns other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there, Flynne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you almost gave me a heart attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny secretly pockets the bundle of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question is, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to score some dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the shit, Flynne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone want to tell me what the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, asshole, you wanna play, we'll play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner takes out a pair of black leather gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious) What did I do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner approaches him.  Danny backs into a corner. DANNY (cont'd) This is a joke, right?  You put him up to this, Garcetti?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti is mum.  Tanner raises his fists.  Danny covers DANNY (cont'd) Come on Tanner ... don't ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner starts swinging but SOMETHING UNEXPECTED ... TANNER HITS LIKE A WIMP. The punches have absolutely no effect. Danny can't help it.  HE STARTS LAUGHING.  Tanner throws creampuffs. Garcetti shakes his head with shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrieking, failing) You think this is funny motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still laughing and covering up) I can't help it, Tanner, you hit like a fucking girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Tanner even madder. His punches become wilder effective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti, do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti tires of the whole show.  He pulls a small SHOCK pocket, switches it on and sticks Danny behind the neck w Danny crumples to the floor.  Tanner kicks him in the fac Garecetti squats down next to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) I still don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti jams the stun-gun into Danny's crotch.  DANNY HO lays off.  Danny lays there whimpering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let me help you.  You're setting up a deal with a Chinese redneck. Quarter of a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti holds up a tap. GARCETTI (cont'd) We just listened to the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny gaped-mouthed. He can't believe it. GARCETTI (cont'd) Somebody tipped up, dipshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the only one I told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he probably only told two people and they probably only told four people and on and one. You know better than to tell a secret to a tweaker, Flynne.  Might just as well broadcast it on the evening news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sitting on a crate. He is sporting a BLACK EYE from kicked him. Garcetti at the desk dusting the plastic wrapper on the b for prints.  Tanner paces back and forth in front of Dann

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met the guy at a party.  He said he wanted to do a biggie. He's new in town so I offered my services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This chink have a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner rolls his eyes. DANNY (cont'd) I swear. That's all he gave me. Hell, I didn't give him my real name either (off their skeptical looks) He figured the less we know about each other, the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not be blowing smoke up My ass, Flynne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that ass-whipping you gave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garcetti suppresses a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing up with the bundle) What's on the other end of this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that I can help you with. Nasty boy ... goes by the name of Pooh-Bear. He's a chef. Check with Palmdale P.D. I'm sure they're keeping box scores on the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you hooked up with some fine citizens, Flynne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh they're all that and the proverbial bag of chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're your taking down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard vig.  Minus five for a certain blabber-mouth moron by the name of Jimmy the Finn, who's living proof that natural selection is a flawed theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner looks at Danny quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really think you were slick enough to pull this off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, I just wanted to make some dough and disappear.  I didn't want to wait around for Domingo to figure out who doubled back on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny holds his hands up DANNY (cont'd) But now I've seen the error of my ways.  I'll just walk away ... call the whole deal off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the bundle of cash to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you want me to roll on these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their silence is answer enough. DANNY (cont'd) No. No way.  These guys catch a whiff and I'm a fucking bag of Bandini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whata you mean I've got no choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you'd rather do a stretch in la casa grande ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took a pig-slicker to the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't look happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domingo sprawled face-down on the tile floor of the showe leaking from underneath him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red car with "IFORGIV" plates parked in the driveway Spanish-style house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY AND VERNE PLUMMER watching TV. Photos of Liz on top of a baby grand piano.  A SHRINE OF CATHOLIC ICONS ABOUND: crucifixes, Virgin Mary's, needle A KNOCK ON THE DOOR.  Nancy gets up to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy and Verne look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Verne sitting at the dining room table.  Nancy pot of coffee.  Verne eyes Danny silently.  Danny won't l eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Nancy, how'd you track me down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy Sutcliffe said he saw you at a bar down in Gardena a few weeks ago. Said you looked so bad, he barely recognized you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy pours the coffee. NANCY (cont'd) Billy's a cop now, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highway Patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you were ... the people you  Were with ... well ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said you were a drug addict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny pushes away from the table.  Nancy grabs Danny's wr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We want to help you, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stays put. NANCY (cont'd) I know everyone deals with grief in their own way.  I know how hard it is to find closure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closure? How do you find closure when her killers are still running around out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found forgiveness in my heart for the people who killed my daughter. I gave my grief to Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you want me to do?  Put it all on Jesus?  Let him sort it out in the afterlife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to deal with this sooner or later, Tom. You can't keep hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I am dealing with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's not my place to pass judgement on you but ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks at the shrine to Liz on top of the piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why don't I see any pictures Of me up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never did like me much, did you Verne? (beat) And you can't stand it that I walked out of there alive and Liz didn't. You think I'm a coward, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verne's silence is answer enough. DANNY (cont'd) I don't blame you for hating me.  At least I understand that. (back to Nancy) But forgiving the butchers who killed Liz well I'm having some trouble with that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, a persecute you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny touches Nancy's hand tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm genuinely happy that you found some peace, Nancy. But you can't forgive for Liz.  No one can.  And you can't forgive for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hatred makes them stronger and you weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't buy that. There's a place for hatred. (beat) Did you know that Liz and I got into an argument the nigh she was killed? I acted like an ass and I never had a chance to apologize to her.  Do you know what that feels

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late to show her you're sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verne slams his hand down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By not disgracing her memory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might as well be spitting on her grave every time you put drugs up your nose.  Or did you just conveniently forget that it was drug dealers who killed my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verne glares at Danny.  No forgiveness in his heart. VERNE (cont'd) You ever think you might be buying drugs from the very people who took her life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny starts to say something.  Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's ... it's complicated. I just want you to know ... I'm not what you think I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny sitting at a table, the lockbox open in front of hi He is endorsing the back of a life insurance check.  His driver's license laying next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kind of busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please open the door, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pockets the check and the license, closes the lockbox to the door. Colette standing on the other side.  Her FACE AND ARMS AR BLUE WITH BRUISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets her come in.  Colette looks away. DANNY (cont'd) Colette ... You've gotta leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been through that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a battered woman's shelter? You can move you kid in with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need my paycheck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can still work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows where I work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find a new job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy. I just got a raise. I need the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always been this stubborn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette cracks a crooked smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From day one. (beat) I was a breach birth. They tried for hours to turn my little butt around. But I wouldn't let 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ass first into the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been that way ever since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny smiles.  He gently touches her eye.  Colette reache touches Danny's bruised eye. COLETTE (cont'd) Look at us.  What a pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette leans in to kiss him, but they bump bad eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we try that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again.  Deep and long.  Danny suddenly pulls ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette goes to touch him. He pulls away. DANNY (cont'd) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny paces uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, maybe you oughta' leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I want to know what the hell is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette comes to a slow realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone else, isn't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FLASHBACK IMAGERY suddenly FLICKERS TO LIFE on the wa Danny - THE MOONLIGH SALTON SEA. Danny freezes.  Looks up at Colette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette waits a beat, then turns to leave. DANNY (cont'd) Don't go. (beat) Please, Colette. (she stops) Stay and talk to me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about Danny's voice - a raw vulnerability - whi seen in him before.  MOVE OFF of Danny and ONTO THE FLASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so tired of lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny's car parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHUBBY GUY sitting on the couch in his underwear, watch WESTERN.  He sits there with wide eyes, GRINDING HIS JAWS Danny, Liz AND BO, the affable owner of the house, lookin the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want to do is go back the way you came and make a left at the bottom. It'll take you right to the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Australian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I fucking hate Australians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and Liz share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a bathroom I can use before we hit the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? First door on the right. It ain't that dirty.  Just kinda' filthy is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Liz) You mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't mind.  That's how come I told you about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking to my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to make it fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny heads down the hallway, Liz looks a little uncomfor LIZ (cont'd) (trying to make small talk) So.  What do you do for a living around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. This and that.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHELVES, SUNDRY ITEMS USED TO DISTILL METH.
dialogues.text: Bo scratching his arms. Liz notices TRACK MARKS ALL OVER BO'S ARMS.  He sees her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeeters. They're bad up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny peeing WHEN HE HEARS ANOTHER CAR PULL UP OUTSIDE. AND CLOSE.  HUSHED VOICES  OUTSIDE THE BATHROOM WINDOW. Danny finishes up.  He steps up onto the tub and peaks ou window.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR. THE ENGINE REMAINS RUNNING.
dialogues.text: Danny frowns, not sure what to make of it.  He steps down and is just about to exit when THE FRONT DOORS IS KICKED ARE FIRED. VOICES SHOUTING. Danny freezes, not sure what to do. His eyes dart around He picks up a large plumber's wrench and goes to the bath MORE SHOTS.  SEMI-AUTOMATIC FIRE. SEVERAL BULLETS slam through the bathroom wall, one strik the shoulder. He slumps to the floor. THE PANDEMONIUM continues in the front room. There is a BULLET HOLE about the size of a fifty cent pie next to Danny's head.  He puts his eye to the hole and lo DANNY'S P.O.V. THROUGH THE HOLE - scanning the room.  Sto ... LIZ. In the confusion, she has managed to hide from t She is squeezed into a tiny space between the sofa and th clings tightly to the curtains, her hands shaking violent ONE THE CURTAIN RINGS - pulled taught by Liz's grip. Danny adjusts his gaze through the hole. THROUGH THE HOLE - scanning to the other side of the room other guy sprawled on the floor. INTRUDER ONE stands over his legs visible. BACK ON LIZ - scared to death, clinging to the curtains. The curtain rings are pulled to the breaking point.

dialogues.speaker: INTRUDER ONE
dialogues.text: Let's go! INTRUDER TWO emerges from the back carrying a small nylon start to head out the front door when ... ... one of the curtain rings breaks with a METALLIC "TING ON DANNY - freaking. His eyes shooting back to Liz. SILENCE. Listening. Then the CREAKING FOOTSTEPS of Intruder One approaching. eternity. Liz can't possibly see Danny through the hole but it look staring directly at him, her body rigid with fear. Danny grabs the wrench again.  Tries to get to his feet b down, either too weak from loss of blood or just plain sc hand is shaking violently. He looks through the hole again. THROUGH THE HOLE - Liz still staring at Danny. THE FOOTST at a agonizing slow pace, then stop. A GUN, ever so slowly, enters FRAME. EXTREME CLOSE UP on they widen. EXTREME CLOSE UP on Danny's eye peering through the hole. FIRED. His eye closes. ON DANNY-his mouth opens to scream BUT NOTHING COMES OUT. And with that it is all over. Danny tries to get to his feet again. Fails, His eyes flu silent except for A FAINT LIQUID SPATTERING. LONG SHOT-Back on the Salton Sea, placid and silvered wit

dialogues.speaker: INT RESIDENTIAL HOTEL ROOM- NIGHT, (LATER)
dialogues.text: Danny and Colette face-to face- in profile, silhouetted b the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died knowing that I was a coward... that I didn't lift a finger to help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing you could have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is inches closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're wrong, I tried to tell  myself the same thing but I could have gotten up. I could have done  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would have killed you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally looks her in the eye) Nothing could be worse then this  slow death I'm living now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette puts her arms around him and hugs him tight. The SEA FLICKERS AND FADES behind them. CLOSE ON DANNY-holding Colette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Colette...I want to help  you, with Quincey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Danny, Don't- DANNY (cont'd) But you gotta be serious about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to do this for you.  I  want to do something good  for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny goes over to the dresser. Takes out a baggie of met DANNY (cont'd) I want you to hide this somewhere where Quincy won't find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Just do what I say. He holds out the baggie. Colette backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stalks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm offering you the chance to take  care of your problems. Take it. (she still hesitates) Don't make the same mistake I did, Colette. Do something while you  have a chance. Do it for your daughter  before something happens. (beat) Believe me, you don't want to  live with this burden. (firm) He helds the baggie out again. Colette  reluctantly takes it from him. DANNY (cont'd) Tommorrow night, when he is asleep.  I want you to beep me at this number. He writes the number down on a dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do that? (off her nod) Then I want you to get out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Just go across  the street and watch. You'll know  when it's safe to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette goes to protest. Danny puts his hand to her mouth she did to him earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. All your problems with  Quincey will be taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty except for Danny and Jimmy in a back booth. Danny s envelope over to Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tem thousand dollars. Everything I could spare. (beat) It's for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? You only owe me five. And  that's not till after we close the deal tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks hurt. DANNY (cont'd) I need you to do me a favor instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait till I tell you what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't matter. I'll do it. And you sure as hell don't have to pay me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy slides the money back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my best friend, man. I'd do  anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny smiles, genuinely touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, look, there's something I have to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, check it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy rolls his sleeve up, revealing a tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Proudly) It's you! I didn't have a picture or nothin' so I had to describe you to the guy. Not bad though, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sits there, admiring the tattoo. Danny stares at Jimmy with pity. DANNY (cont'd) I really have to tell you something. It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a tweaker. (beat) I don't use drugs. I never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny is deadpan.  Jimmy starts laughing DANNY (cont'd) I'm not joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy keeps laughing. Danny staring, deadpan, Jimmy slowl laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...I've seen you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? When did you ever see me use?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't like that Queen Elizabeth question, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever notice how I always showed  up, in the middle of a binge? Left  before it was over? How I sneak away  for cap-naps? How when the crank  came around to me, I always said I'd  just done one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy slack-jawed. DANNY (cont'd) You asked me how I always keep my  shit together. Well, that's how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever noticed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? A bunch of amped -out tweakers? It was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is agitated and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... why? Why would you pretend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you want me to do you some big favor? DANNY (cont'd) It's cool. I understand Danny gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait (beat) If you don't trust me, why did you  tell me that stuff about not using drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to see you end  up like Kujo and those other losers. (beat) I thought that maybe if you knew that  I didn't use, you might see it in  yourself to go clear.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BACK OF CINDERBLOCK BAR- DAY, (LATER)
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Danny squinting in the mid-morning sun. They st face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mad at me, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... a little. I wish you  would have let me in on it from the  beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny taps Jimmy's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you can get that tattoo removed, don't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy rubs his arm where the tattoo is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah... I want to keep it. (beat) Maybe I can use it for like, inspiration ...you know...like when I detox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny takes the envelope from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want you to take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny tries to hive Jimmy the envelope. Jimmy pushes it a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't be a favor if you were  paying me. I'll just take my five  when the deal is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man. Jimmy the Finn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tanner and Garcetti's car parked on the periphery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny in the back seat dialing a CELL PHONE. A MICRORECEI TO THE PHONE. Tanner and Garcetti listening through earpieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBA answers a cell phone on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure you come alone. This  guy won't like any surprises

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't a idiot, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bubba hangs up. Danny turns the phone off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man of few words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny hands the phone back to Garcetti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you clowns watching my back? What  do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make sure you hit the floor when  we come in. It could get ugly in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd hate to shoot you by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny gets out of the car. Shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny watches them drive away. When he is sure that they looks around. Sees... ...A PLUMBER'S TRUCK parked on the other side of the park

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN HISPANIC GUY behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: HISPANIC GUY
dialogues.text: He's coming in. As Danny approaches the truck, the door slides open. He p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny pulls a TINY MICROPHONE AND WIRE from inside his sh it to... ...Bubba, who sits in front of a BANK OF LISTENING EQUIPM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to go meet the team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLUMBER'S TRUCK enters the underground parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN F.B.I. AGENTS in a small conference room, looking at. ...Danny and Bubba, sitting at the head of the table. BUB wearing his security badge, which reads, SPECIAL AGENT TE stands up and addresses the group. And he really does have a SOUTHERN ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For those of you who don't know this  is Tom Van Allen... a.k.a.  Danny  Flynne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks self-conscious. TRAHN (cont'd) About a year and half ago, Mr. Van  Allen's wife was murdered at a meth  lab out near the Salton Sea. No one  was ever apprehended for the crime  but local authorities have always  assumed it was a hit and grab  perpetrated by rival drug dealers.  That is, until Tom here took it upon  himself to conduct a one-man  undercover operation at great risk to  his own personal safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the agents pipes up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a civilian? (off Trahn's nod) How the hell did you pull this off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trahn turns to Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played the long shot. Just got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny and DETECTIVE BOOKMAN, a homicide detective, sittin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the car? The model?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny shakes his head. BOOKMAN (cont'd) Was it a truck?  S.U.V.? Sedan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I saw was the headlights. The high  beams were on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even a guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off0 How many times do we have to go through  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER DETECTIVE enters the room, hands something to boo whispers into Bookman's ear. Bookman nods. BOOKMAN (cont'd) You said one of the perpetrators crossed  in front of the headlights ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he was in silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were wearing ski masks. I told  you all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
