dialogues.text: Danny can't help from laughing at the irony.  Beads of sw forming on his blanched face.  He looks at Colette with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good, princess. I'll give you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, it's not what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks down at his bloody stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owed them money ... a lot of money ... they didn't give me a choice.  You know how it works.  When I got to know you, I tried to back out ... that's when they did this ... (she indicates the bruises) But I told them I wouldn't do it .. I didn't want to see you get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny stares at her, not sure what to believe.  He looks Quincey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She selling me a bill, home boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincey shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, she ain't lying.  She took a pretty good beating from you, ace. I seen grown men crack after a lot less.  But not this bitch. (beat) It was very touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They threatened to kill my daughter. (beat) I had no choice. (beat) I'm sorry, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks at Colette, imagining the awful beating she m taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay. (Danny touches her face.) (beat) God damn, you're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE BED - THE CARPET IGNITES.  The fire spreads qui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincey grabs her arm. QUINCEY (cont'd) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drapes go up in flames.  Quincey puts the gun to the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna die here with him or come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colette, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to leave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter needs you.  Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire continues to spread.  Colette kisses Danny on th Quincey pulls her away. Collette looks back one last time just as the flames reac cutting off any escape. Danny breathing hard. He gets up.  Staggers over to the m his trumpet is. He opens the case and takes the trumpet out. He plops down on the bed and BLOWS A FEW NOTES. He stops a smile on his lips. He starts to play SAETA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the opening scene.  The whole room ablaze.  Danny bed, playing the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is it?  Who am I after it's all said and done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pieces of the roof start falling in. DANNY (cont'd) Tom Van Allen or Danny Flynne? (beat) Avenging angel or plain old Judas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops playing. DANNY (cont'd) (weakly) You decide, friend.  You decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes. DANNY (cont'd) I'm too tired ... so you decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops his trumpet and lays his head back.

dialogues.text: Emerging from the flames into a dark hallway. Danny's eyes flutter as he seemingly continues to float. DANNY (cont'd) Am I dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A linoleum floor rushes underneath. DANNY (cont'd) Linoleum.  This must be hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny exits a cab and heads towards a coffee shop.  He lo man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've had some time to think about it and it's pretty simple after all.  I guess it's like the man said - "Man is the measure of all things." I should know.  I ran the gamut. Avenging Angel, Judas, loving husband, prodigal son, prince of Denmark.  I was all of those things. (beat) Tom Van Allen got his revenge. Good for Tom.  And Danny Flynne? He got gut-shot for being the low-life rat that he was.  Sucks for him. (beat) But as far as I'm concerned, they're both dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny looks through the window of the shop. Colette inside, working the counter, pouring coffee. DANNY (cont'd) But what about this guy? Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny enters the shop. DANNY (cont'd) To tell you the truth, I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny takes a seat at the counter.  Colette turns and see DANNY (cont'd) But I like his chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at one another for a beat, then smile.  Colett some coffee. DANNY (cont'd) I really like his chances.
